module.description: Always On (AON) IO Controller - controls IO operation when the MCU IO Controller (IOC) is powered off and resides in the AON domain. Note: This module only supports 32 bit Read/Write access from MCU.

register.description: Internal. Only to be used through TI provided API.

bitfield.description: Internal. Only to be used through TI provided API.
Internal. Only to be used through TI provided API.

register.description:
IO Latch Control
Controls transparency of all latches holding I/O or configuration state from the MCU IOC

bitfield.description: Software should not rely on the value of a reserved. Writing any other value than the reset value may result in undefined behavior.

Controls latches between MCU IOC and AON_IOC.
The latches are transparent by default.
They must be closed prior to power off the domain(s) controlling the IOs in order to preserve IO values on external pins.

bitenum.token: Latches are transparent, meaning the value of the IO is directly controlled by the GPIO or peripheral value
bitenum.description: Latches are transparent, meaning the value of the IO is directly controlled by the GPIO or peripheral value

bitenum.token: Latches are static, meaning the current value on the IO pin is frozen by latches and kept even if GPIO module or a peripheral module is turned off
bitenum.description: Latches are static, meaning the current value on the IO pin is frozen by latches and kept even if GPIO module or a peripheral module is turned off

bitfield.description: Software should not rely on the value of a reserved. Writing any other value than the reset value may result in undefined behavior.
0: Output enable active. SCLK_LF output on IO pin that has PORT_ID (e.g. IOC:IOCFG0.PORT_ID) set to AON_CLK32K. 1: Output enable not active
